activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J. Williams

defendant.name: Williams, Nicholas J.

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM 22CF30/21CT26/ 22CF130 - Defendant Nicholas J. Williams in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Nicholas J. Williams for 22CF30/21CT26.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson appears in person for NW for case 22CF130.

22CF130 - Defendant has received the complaint. Max penalties stated. Court speaks about the defendant rights to a preliminary hearing. Attorney Erickson waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. 

Court states that 22CF30 would be needing a preliminary hearing as well. Attorney Richards asks for a preliminary hearing to be set and a waiver will be presented if needed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
11:08 AM 21CT26, 22CF30, 22CF130 - Defendant Nicholas J. Williams in court.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas J. Williams.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards has been appointed in 21CT26, 22CF30 but not in 22CF130. Attorney Richards hasn't received the complaint in 22CF130. 

Court will reset 22CF130 to allow time for the defendant to appoint Attorney Richards.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:10 PM Defendant Nicholas J Williams in court. DA Harper for the State. Complaint not filed yet. Def has contacted SPD and is eligible; SPD didn't have an attorney to represent him at today's appearance. Def notes he has Atty. Richards in another matter. This judge represented the Def in his other matter, the one that is in front of Judge Allen on 9/27. Judge McDougal recuses from this case. When the DA files the complaint, clerk to prepare the application for judicial assignment. In the meantime, Def has been advised to be back in court on 9/27 at 11; likely, that will be in front of Judge Allen.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

To Those Posting Cash Bond
Payable # 66767

1:22 PM Defendant Nicholas J Williams appeared by video from the Richland County Jail without counsel. DA Harper appeared in person for the State; making request re bond - 10K cash bond with no drink conditions. Def addresses the Court - cannot post cash bond. Court orders 10K cash. Conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included. 

Initial set for 8/31 at 1 p.m.
